intro: Strychnos torresiana, commonly known as the Torresian star-apple, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered white or yellowish flowers, followed by bright red, fleshy berries that contain several seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Loganiaceae family. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in various cultures.
